attributes.action: Build barriers on all tube stations that only open once the train has stopped
attributes.additional_details: On the weekend at embankment station, I got pushed towards the tracks by a man as the train was coming into the platform. Luckily I wasn’t injured but this wouldn’t be an issue if there was safety barriers there to prevent these sort of incidents from occurring.
attributes.background: For every tube station to have barriers that remain shut until the train has stopped moving, then the doors open to let people off and on. They have these in some central stations and airports already and are much safer for everyone to use.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is a matter for Transport for London and the London Mayor.

The London Assembly has its own petitions process. You can find out more about how to petition the London Assembly here: https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions
